intro: Boronia fastigiata subsp. tenuior, commonly known as the narrow-leaved boronia, is a shrub native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers during spring and summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. This subspecies is often found in heathlands and woodland habitats.
